com.launchdarkly.testhelpers

Class Assertions

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.launchdarkly.testhelpers.Assertions

  • public abstract class Assertions
extends java.lang.Object
    General test assertions that may be helpful in unit tests. For more specific categories of assertions, see ConcurrentHelpers, JsonAssertions, and TypeBehavior.
    Since:
    1.1.0

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Assertions() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static <T> T assertPolledFunctionReturnsValue(long timeout, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeoutUnit, long interval, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit intervalUnit, java.util.function.Supplier<T> fn)
      Repeatedly calls a function until it returns a non-null value or until a timeout elapses, whichever comes first.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

    • Method Detail

      • assertPolledFunctionReturnsValue

        public static <T> T assertPolledFunctionReturnsValue(long timeout,
                                                     java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeoutUnit,
                                                     long interval,
                                                     java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit intervalUnit,
                                                     java.util.function.Supplier<T> fn)
        Repeatedly calls a function until it returns a non-null value or until a timeout elapses, whichever comes first.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the return type
        Parameters:
        timeout - maximum time to wait
        timeoutUnit - time unit for timeout (null defaults to milliseconds)
        interval - how often to call the function
        intervalUnit - time unit for interval (null defaults to milliseconds)
        fn - the function to call
        Returns:
        the function's return value
        Throws:
        java.lang.AssertionError - if the function did not return a non-null value before the timeout
